Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which the ISIS caliphate was captured under President Trump's administration, stating that "we captured 100% of the ISIS caliphate." In reality, significant progress had been made in recapturing territory from ISIS prior to Trump taking office.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that about half of the territory held by ISIS had already been regained under President Obama's administration, as stated by Trump's own administration officials.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient support as it ignores the progress made in recapturing territory from ISIS before Trump took office. It also fails to provide specific evidence or data to support the assertion that "we had almost nothing" when Trump became president.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the progress made in recapturing territory from ISIS was solely due to Trump's actions, disregarding the efforts of the coalition forces and previous administration.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the recapture of ISIS-held territory was a result of a continuous effort by coalition forces and strategies implemented by previous administrations, rather than solely attributed to Trump's actions.
